* Communicate the vision, strategy, and objectives throughout the organization, encouraging cross-divisional collaboration and teamwork to drive continuous improvement


**Your profile**

* Thorough understanding of developing and implementing sales/marketing strategies that focus on selling solutions is required.
* Practical experience and hands-on mentality with a can-do attitude.
* Proven ability to develop and execute a growth plan to achieve market leadership coupled with several years of management experience.
* Ability to structure and manage a growing organization in terms of organizational setup, processes, management, and employees.


**Your career driven by curiosity and customer insights**
 At Nets, we are working towards realizing a one-company approach to development, innovation and doing business, where you’ll be encouraged to think across borders and business areas to find new ways of merging our products, new technologies and market trends into innovative new solutions.
   

  

 We want to attract, develop and engage the best talent, which means that at Nets, you’ll be working with colleagues across the Nordics. Whether it is innovation or operation that makes you tick, our company structure allows you to build your own career and grow in a business that encompasses all aspects of the digital payment value chain. We work in a thriving environment characterized by team play and informality and with plenty of social activities within sports, culture and social network.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

title: Treasury Analyst
description:
Do you want to be at the heart of transforming financial health for millions? At Anyfin, we’re not just changing how people manage money—we’re building a future where financial power belongs to everyone.
   

  

 Since 2017, we’ve helped customers across Sweden, Finland, Norway, and Germany save millions by refinancing expensive loans. But we’re just getting started. New markets, new products, and innovative solutions are on the horizon, and to make it happen, we need exceptional people like you to join our journey.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 Anyfin’s treasury team ensures Anyfin has the necessary funding and capital to drive rapid growth while effectively managing liquidity and financial risks. In this role, you will focus on tasks such as liquidity management and liquidity planning, analysing funding and capital needs as well as financial risk exposures and reporting to relevant authorities. As our Treasury Analyst, you’ll be a critical part of a team that’s essential to Anyfin’s success. Think of this as more than a title—this is your opportunity to play a key role in shaping how we grow and operate.
   

  

 Here’s a closer look at what you’ll be diving into:
   

  

* Take ownership of cash management, liquidity planning and regulatory reporting, setting up infrastructure in new markets and managing interactions with our main transaction banks.
* Be involved in executing the funding strategy by planning and managing our debt financing to support the growth of the business.
* Perform analyses and regular stress tests to monitor Anyfin’s capital and liquidity position
* Be involved in the FX management by supporting the setup of processes for FX hedging.
* Streamline and innovate recurring processes, collaborating with financial back-end engineers and data engineering teams to automate reporting and payment infrastructure.


 This role is your chance to make a tangible impact while working on exciting, meaningful projects that support both the business and society at large.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Are you the type who loves solving puzzles, thrives in fast-moving environments, and brings a “let’s make it happen” mindset to every challenge? Then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

**Here’s What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: 1–5 years in treasury. Experience with cash management, liquidity planning, hedging, risk management, or regulatory reporting will set you up for success.
* Experience (continued): Experience from a financial institution is a must to be able to hit the ground running.
* Skills: Proficiency in MS office and the ability to extract, populate and analyse data as needed
* Mindset: Analytical, detail-oriented, and solution-driven with a collaborative, can-do attitude.
* Education: BSc or MSc in business, engineering, or a similar field.
* Languages: Fluent in Swedish and English.


 If you’re familiar with financial markets, treasury principles, and concepts like profit and loss, balance sheets, and cash flow, you’ll feel right at home here.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 At Anyfin, we believe work should be as fulfilling as it is impactful. That’s why we offer:
   

  

* Exciting growth opportunities where you’ll develop skills in risk management, portfolio analytics, and process improvement.
* A competitive compensation package that rewards your hard work.
* A centrally located office that’s cozy, welcoming, and well-equipped.
* Extra time off on your birthday because you deserve to celebrate!
* A team of smart, ambitious, and fun colleagues who share your passion for making a difference.


 Most importantly, you’ll have the chance to shape how we grow as a company, impact thousands of lives, and build financial solutions that truly make a difference.
   

  

**This isn’t just another job — it’s a chance to make a difference.** 
 If this opportunity excites you as much as it excites us, click “Apply” below and let’s get started.
   

  

 We can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to reduce the costs of high-interest loans, get a detailed overview of their fixed costs, and see their credit score.

title: RESERVATION & TICKETING AGENT – OFFICE IN KISTA, STOCKHOLM SWEDEN (M/F/X)
description:

**Are you passionate about the aviation industry? Do you have experience in reservations and ticketing systems such as Sabre? Then we have the perfect opportunity for you!**

 Ethiopian Airlines, founded in 1945, is the national airline of Ethiopia and a proud member of the Star Alliance. Headquartered in Addis Ababa, it operates from its main hub at Bole International Airport (ADD), connecting passengers and cargo to over 50 international destinations and 32 domestic locations. With a modern fleet of 30 aircraft, Ethiopian Airlines continues to expand its global reach, offering reliable and efficient service as Africa’s leading airline.

**Your Profile**

* Experience in group handling
* Fluency in Swedish and English (spoken and written) is required
* Strong customer service skills with attention to detail
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* A passion for aviation and travel


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to work for our client Ethiopian Airlines, Africa’s leading airline, within a global aviation environment
* A dynamic and international workplace in Stockholm
* A role within a well-established and growing company, AVIAREPS
* Professional development and training opportunities
* Competitive salary and benefits


 If you are ready for this exciting opportunity and want to be part of Ethiopian Airlines' success in Sweden, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your CV by clicking on ‘Apply now’

title: Senior Threat Intelligence Specialist
description:
**Job ID: 28875**
 At Nordea, we are committed to being a trusted partner for our customers and society. By joining us, you will play a key role in shaping the future of banking. Bring your ideas, skills, and unique perspective. With us, you will be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
   

  

**Are you our new Senior Threat Intelligence Specialist?**
 The Cyber Threat Management team at Nordea is looking for an experienced professional to help drive our threat intelligence capability forward. This role involves developing intelligence strategies, refining data analysis methodologies, and collaborating with key stakeholders to mitigate emerging threats.
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 Welcome to the Cyber Threat Management team. As part of Nordea’s Cyber Defence Centre, we are a trusted unit dedicated to protecting the bank by leveraging our expertise and collaborating externally to combat threats. Our extensive technical knowledge, combined with specialized competencies in Investigations and Intelligence, makes us a valuable partner both within and beyond the organization.
   

  

 Our threat intelligence capability spans across the bank, working closely with key stakeholders to provide high-quality intelligence and insights that support security initiatives.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Monitor and report on Nordea’s evolving threat landscape using internal and external data sources.
* Identify and manage new and existing information sources.
* Serve as an SME in tactical and operational intelligence analysis and casework.
* Support the development of Nordea’s Threat Intelligence capabilities, including the enhancement of our threat intelligence platform.
* Contribute to research, development, and training initiatives.


 As part of a team spread across the Nordics, you will work alongside highly skilled professionals with diverse technical expertise.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Furthermore, to succeed in this role, we believe you:**
* Have a strong sense of ethics, objectivity, and integrity.
* Possess a research-oriented mindset and a keen analytical eye.
* Are self-motivated yet thrive in collaborative team environments.
* Adapt well to a fast-paced, priority-driven environment.
* Are eager to learn, experiment, and share new ideas.


**Skills And Experience**
 A relevant university degree and/or certification is beneficial. However, a passion for problem-solving, critical thinking, and seeing the broader context will be essential for success in this role.
   

  

**We believe you will thrive in this role if you recognize yourself in some of the following:**
* At least 3 years of professional experience in intelligence, with cyber domain experience as a plus.
* Familiarity with threat intelligence analytical frameworks, intelligence cycles, methodologies, and processes.
* Experience in developing and producing intelligence reports, both technical and non-technical, using analytical frameworks and methodologies.
* A track record of establishing and maintaining professional networks within relevant peer organizations.
* Knowledge of Cyber Threat Intelligence, including frameworks and models such as MITRE ATT&CK, Diamond Model, and industry-standard threat modelling.
* A broad understanding of IT and IT security is advantageous.


 In Nordea the working language is English, but it is preferable that you are fluent in one or more of the Nordic languages.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Nest step**
 Welcome to apply by submitting your application no later than 10/03/2025. Please be informed that applications will be reviewed continuously and interviews might also be conducted during this time.
   

  

 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages cannot be accepted due to GDPR regulations. Kindly also be informed that this position requires security clearance.
   

  

 For more information, you are welcome to contact hiring manager Christian Frydensberg, Head of Cyber Threat Management at christian.frydensberg@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are!
   

  

 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

 #Full-time

title: Servicepersonal Brödernas Åkersberga
description:
Är du sugen på nya utmaningar, en karriär inom restaurangbranschen och ett företag där det går snabbt att växa? Då har du kommit rätt!
   

  

 Vilka är Brödernas?
   

  

 Brödernas bedriver med framgång sin verksamhet i hela Sverige från Umeå i norr till Malmö i söder. Brödernas expanderar i en rasande takt med visionen att bli känt även utanför Sveriges gränser. Vår ambition är att Brödernas ska associeras med god kvalité och fantastisk service. Vi har idag över 90 öppnade enheter i Sverige och vi öppnar nya enheter varje månad.
   

  

 Det viktiga för oss är att oavsett vilket mål du har för framtiden så har vi garanterat en plats för dig. Hos oss är det dina egna ambitioner och resultat som avgör hur långt du kan gå.
   

  

**Vad innebär jobbet som Servicepersonal hos oss?**
 I tjänsten ingår det att vara ansiktet utåt. Dina arbetsuppgifter består av att välkomna gäster, ta emot beställningar i kassan eller vid bordet, servera mat och dryck, se till att gästerna är nöjda och lämnar restaurangen med gott humör. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår också att öppna och stänga samt säkerställa en ansvarsfull alkoholservering.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person har du god arbetsmoral, är en social person och tycker om att ha kontakt med människor. Du är samarbetsvillig och trevlig. Du har ett öga för vad du behöver prioritera och tar självständiga beslut i ditt arbete.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Vi erbjuder en fartfylld arbetsplats som är mitt under en stor expansion vilket innebär mycket goda möjligheter till att utvecklas med företaget.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 När du har sökt tjänsten så kommer du att få tillgång till en länk för en digital intervju med roboten Hubert som tar ca 20 - 30 minuter.
   

  

 Syftet med att Hubert-intervjun är vi vill ge alla kandidater möjligheten att berätta mer om sig själva samt för oss att säkerställa att alla kandidater blir bedömda på samma sätt, oavsett kön, ålder och etnicitet.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du svarar på denna inom 48 - 72 timmar för att snabbt komma vidare i processen. Kolla gärna denna artikel innan intervjun för tips och tricks: https://my.hubert.ai/advice-before-hubert-interview/sv-se Du kommer därefter bli kontaktad av en av våra rekryterare om du blir aktuell för en andra intervju.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Intervjuer sker löpande så tveka inte! Sök!**
**Are you eager for new challenges, a career in the restaurant industry and a company where you can grow fast? Then you have come to the right place!**
 Who are the Brödernas?
   

  

 Brödernas successfully conducts its operations throughout Sweden from Umeå in the north to Malmö in the south. Brödernas are expanding at a rapid pace with the vision of becoming known even outside Sweden's borders. Our ambition is for Brödernas to be associated with good quality and fantastic service. We currently have over 80 opened units in Sweden and we open new units every month.
   

  

 The important thing for us is that no matter what goal you have for the future, we have guaranteed a place for you. With us, it is your own ambitions and results that determine how far you can go.
   

  

**What does the job as a Service Personnel with us mean?**
 The service includes being the face outwards. Your duties consist of welcoming guests, taking orders at checkout or at the table, serving food and drink, making sure guests are happy and leaving the restaurant in a good mood. The tasks also include opening and closing and ensuring responsible alcohol serving.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As a person, you have a good work ethic, are a social person and enjoy having contact with people. You are cooperative and nice. You have an eye for what you need to prioritize and make independent decisions in your work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 We offer a fast-paced workplace that is in the middle of a major expansion, which means very good opportunities to develop with the company.
   

  

**The recruitment process**
 Once you have applied for the job, you will have access to a link for a digital interview with the robot Hubert, which takes about 20-30 minutes.
   

  

 The purpose of the Hubert interview is to give all candidates the opportunity to tell more about themselves and for us to ensure that all candidates are judged in the same way, regardless of gender, age and ethnicity.
   

  

 We are happy to see that you respond to this within 48 - 72 hours to quickly move forward in the process. You will then be contacted by one of our recruiters if you become relevant for a second interview.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Interviews are ongoing, so do not hesitate! Apply!**

title: Program Manager
description:
**Global Technologies division**
*Mycronic is a global high-tech company whose innovative solutions have been advancing electronics technology for over 40 years. Today we continue to grow and serve customers in an expanding variety of industries. What we do impacts the future of technology, and in turn, the way we live our lives tomorrow.*
*We're looking for people to join our talented, motivated and friendly team on the cutting-edge. Here, in an open, collaborative and flexible environment, you'll work alongside leading industry experts and take on challenging projects that bring tomorrow's electronics to life.*
 At Mycronic, we love what we do, but most importantly who we do it with. Because to us the relationships we have with our customers and each other are the keys to success. Take part in the excitement of working with innovative people and global businesses who are elevating today's standards in modern electronics. Share in the responsibility of bringing great ideas to life within an inclusive culture that not only promotes personal growth and embraces diversity but depends upon it. We are looking for like-minded people to join our talented, motivated and friendly team. Here, in an open, collaborative and flexible environment, you will work alongside leading industry experts and take on challenging projects that bring tomorrow's electronics to life.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 Mycronic's Global Technologies (GT) division is expanding our team and seeking a Program Manager to join us. This role is responsible for developing a systematic approach to managing multiple corporate initiatives, ensuring all deliverables are completed on time, and providing hands-on support. The Program Manager will act as a value-added business partner to multiple key stakeholders across the GT division. Working closely with the GT Senior Vice President and GT Management Team, this role provides operational support by producing consolidated corporate initiative reports and by implementing program strategies to diminish key stakeholders' workload. This role supports divisional communications and marketing efforts, as needed. The Program Manager will contribute to achieving GT's business objectives, in addition to performing other duties as assigned.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Drives corporate programs for the division, including, but not limited to, the annual customer survey initiative, the sustainability program, product compliance, trade compliance, business continuity planning, and enterprise risk management
* Develops a streamlined process for program management, resulting in a consistent and aligned divisional approach; provides program education as well as regular program updates to key stakeholders to ensure the smooth flow of information
* Coordinates divisional document control, quality management, and internal audit initiatives
* Analyzes program performance metrics, key performance indicators, and key risk indicators; based on findings, creates and implements program improvements
* Provides key stakeholder program support (creates and maintains corporate initiative deliverables calendar, provides regular status updates, organizes meetings, prepares program presentations, etc.)


**Experience And Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, finance, or related disciplines, preferred
* Five years plus of relevant work experience preferred
* Demonstrated outstanding organizational skills with an ability to keep track of multiple work streams with key stakeholders; ability to prioritize tasks by deliverable deadline(s)
* Ability to build effective relationships with key stakeholders and manage stressful situations with measured calm and decisiveness
* Strong verbal and written communication skills with outstanding grammar and proofreading abilities
* Excellent analytical skills; ability to quickly aggregate and analyze information, as well as effectively present and execute ideas
* Ability to take initiative, act independently, and strategically directs one's own work
* Demonstrates exceptional common sense, maturity, and discretion, and maintains confidentiality at all times; strong ability to foster strong cross-departmental relationships
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Products
* Travel Requirements up to 25%


**Details**
 Department: divisional management team
   

  

 Place of employment: Headquarters in Täby, right outside Stockholm
   

  

 Country: Sweden
   

  

 Application deadline: 7 March 2025
   

  

 Contact person/s: Cynthia Dodick Seyffert, Head of Human Resources, Global Technologies division
   

  

 cynthia.dodickseyffert@mycronic.com 1-617-595-5619
   

  

 How to apply: Apply by clicking the "Apply" button
   

  

**Equal opportunity employer**
 Mycronic is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity and inclusion. We are committed to ensuring and cultivating a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Operating in a global market like we do, it is a necessity to have a diverse workforce to serve our customers that are spread across different markets and cultures. Diversity, equity and inclusion is important for our innovation power and for staying competitive in a rapidly changing world and marketplace."
   

  

**A culture of collaboration and personal growth**
 At Mycronic, we love what we do, but most importantly who we do it with. Because to us the relationships we have with our customers and each other are the keys to success.
   

  

 Take part in the excitement of working with innovative people and global businesses who are elevating today's standards in modern electronics. Share in the responsibility of bringing great ideas to life within an inclusive culture that not only promotes personal growth and embraces diversity but depends upon it.
   

  

 Here you are expected to have a voice and will be encouraged to get involved. It's this very mindset that empowers our people to make a positive difference for a broad range of businesses, society and the planet - every day.
   

  

 Click to learn more about Mycronic and what it's like to work with us: https://www.mycronic.com/career/

title: Senior Business Developer/Project Manager/ Linköping
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Business Developer/Project Manager for an exciting opportunity at Saab’s Special Mission & Regional Aircraft (SMRA) division in Linköping. This role focuses on conducting a feasibility study on scenario planning methodologies in a complex multi-project environment to enhance capacity planning for SMRA and associated organizations.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Lead Feasibility Study:**
* Conduct an in-depth analysis of existing scenario planning methodologies.
* Identify gaps and areas for improvement in current capacity planning processes.
* Develop a structured approach to scenario planning in a multi-project environment.


**Capacity Planning Optimization**
* Assess how different scenario models can improve resource allocation.
* Collaborate with various departments to understand workload, project dependencies, and risk factors.
* Propose strategies to enhance overall operational efficiency.


**Implementation Support**
* Beyond the feasibility study, there is an opportunity to take part in implementing the recommended solutions.
* Work closely with teams to develop tools, frameworks, and workflows for practical application.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the newly introduced methodologies.


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience in business development, project management, or strategic planning.
* Strong background in scenario planning, forecasting, or risk assessment in a multi-project environment.
* Knowledge of aerospace, defense, or complex engineering projects is highly desirable.
* Ability to analyze, structure, and present complex information clearly.
* Strong collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Software Tester – ERP & Cloud Systems
description:
### **Requirements**


* Prior experience in food production, manufacturing, or supply chain apps is highly beneficial.
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment, using tools like JIRA, Azure DevOps, or
* Understanding of Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) could be helpful if integrated with your system.

title: DevOps Engineer (2-5 years experience)
description:
**Start****23-03-2025****Duration****7-9 months**
  
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Telecom-client. The expected seniority level is between 2-5 years.

**Start:** End of March

**End:** End of December with possible extension

**Location:** Stockholm, on-site required 2-3 days per week

**Description of role/assignment**


The consultant will be engaged to design, implement, and maintain infrastructure and application deployment processes using modern DevOps tools and best practices. The role focuses on automating and optimizing software deployment pipelines, enhancing security, and improving system reliability. The consultant will work closely with development, operations, and security teams to ensure a seamless and efficient software delivery lifecycle.


Key Responsibilities of the consultant


Containerization & Orchestration:

* Build, manage, and optimize Docker containers and Kubernetes clusters.
* Configure and maintain Cilium for networking and security policies within Kubernetes.
* Implement and manage service discovery and networking with Consul.


CI/CD & Deployment Automation:

* Design, implement, and maintain GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.
* Optimize deployment workflows to ensure efficiency and reliability.
* Work on traffic routing and load balancing using Traefik and NGINX.
* Security & Networking:
* Implement best security practices for containerized environments.
* Configure Cilium for network security policies.
* Manage API gateways and reverse proxies using Traefik and NGINX.


Infrastructure Automation & Management:

* Design, deploy, and maintain infrastructure using Terraform and Ansible for provisioning and configuration management.
* Ensure system scalability, performance, and security through automation.


Monitoring & Troubleshooting:

* Troubleshoot system and application issues in cloud and containerized environments.
* Ensure high availability and performance tuning across deployments.


Required skills of the consultant

* Strong hands-on experience with Linux system administration.
* Proficiency in Kubernetes and container orchestration.
* Expertise in Docker and containerized application deployment.
* Experience in creating and maintaining GitLab CI/CD pipelines.
* Hands-on experience with Terraform and Ansible for infrastructure as code (IaC) and configuration management.
* Knowledge of Cilium for Kubernetes networking and security.
* Experience with Consul for service discovery and networking.
* Understanding of Traefik and NGINX for reverse proxy and load balancing.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills in cloud and containerized environments.


Plus Points:

* Familiarity with JavaScript for application debugging or minor development tasks.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
***Senior Platform Engineer***

  


**Who We Are and What We Do**

  



At SilverRail, we're on a mission to reshape the way the world travels, and we're inviting you to be part of this journey. Rail is becoming the go-to choice for short and medium-haul travel worldwide, and we're here to help make it happen.

  



In the face of the ongoing climate crisis, our vision is crystal clear. We are transforming the online customer experience for rail travel, making it easier than ever for customers to find, buy and use rail. Our cutting-edge technology is the backbone of rail and travel agencies worldwide, making it effortless for travellers to choose the eco-friendly option and reduce their carbon footprint.

  



We have nearly 15 years of trailblazing success behind us, and our teams are spread across the globe, with bases in London, Boston, Brisbane, and Stockholm. We thrive on the philosophy of 'fail-fast-fail-early,' which drives us to find ingenious solutions to complex challenges.

  



Join us, and help shape the future of travel!

  


**The Role**

  



As a Senior Platform Engineer you will be part of a global team that designs, builds and operates Silver Rail's cloud native SaaS platform. You will be utilising industry leading tools and practices, and embedding core principals of SRE, Security and Automation into our services. Those who join us will have the opportunity to design, implement, and manage all aspects of the cloud platforms and infrastructure. You will receive hands-on experience building the next-generation SaaS platform serving travellers around the world.



To help us through our next phase of growth, we're looking for smart, forward-thinking, and motivated engineers that are capable of reliably operating and maintaining our systems and supporting networks.

  


**Key Responsibilities**

  


* Contribute to building and enhancing every aspect of SilverRail's evolving infrastructure and platform as a service.
* Support internal and external customers, and build on key cloud technologies
* Manage service reliability functions such as monitoring & alerting solutions, latency & load performance, uptime, and error budgets.
* Develop, maintain, and utilise SilverRail's deployment automation, configuration management, and orchestration systems.
* Design, build, and manage SilverRail's cloud environments and associated technologies
* Own the deployment process to ensure streamlined, zero-downtime, and orchestrated service delivery.
* Work with cross functional teams to optimise processes, application development, and customer support.
* On-call responsibilities

  


**Required Competence and Skills**

  


* Hands on experience in operations engineer, DevOps, SRE, sysadmin role or academic knowledge
* 3-5 years of industry experience in an Infrastructure function, including exposure to Public Cloud services
* Knowledge of Linux based operating systems
* Experience in programming practices and Software Development Life Cycle models
* Experience in a common programming language or scripting language (python, ruby, bash, etc)
* Experience with Infrastructure as code concepts and languages, Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM etc
* Experience with Container technologies and platforms such as Kubernetes (AKS/EKS/GKE/Rancher/Openshift/Anthos) would be beneficial
* Knowledge of Git and Git based workflows such as GitOps
* Advocate of software best practices and Agile SDLC.
* Software development experience is highly valued.

  


**Why us?**

  


* We are a globally accredited Great Place To Work: https://www.greatplacetowork.co.uk/workplace/item/6789/SilverRail+Technologies&time=1683041411341#career

  


* We are an accredited flexible company and were named in Flexa's Top 50 Most Flexible Companies: https://flexa.careers/companies/silverrail

  


* We are a remote first working organisation, and for this role we would welcome applications from candidates who are comfortable working remotely but willing to travel for team meetings when needed.

  


* We offer a highly competitive benefits package including private healthcare insurance, rail discounts and flexible working.

  


* We provide a wealth of career development opportunities with training that is individual, focused on improving your skills and helping you become the best professional you can be.

  


* Our team's health and wellness is genuinely important to us, so we offer a number of wellbeing seminars and membership to the #1 leading meditation app.

  


* We are the fourth company in the world to become reproductively responsible, accredited by Hertility providing educational workshops around women's health, family planning and fertility as well as progressive leave policies & hormone testing

  


* A unique opportunity to work for a tech company that is helping the environment by revolutionising the way we travel.

  



Our values are simple: **Do Good** by working for a better tomorrow; **Think Big Act Smart** by being curious, adaptable and data-driven; and remember that through collaboration we will always be **Stronger Together**.

  


**\*We are a neurodiverse employer and are working hard to improve our recruitment processes, so if there is any way that we can make the recruitment experience better for you then please let us know in your application - all information will be treated as strictly confidential\***

title: POWER PLATFORM SPECIALIST
description:
**FÖRETAG**


Stena Metall AB

**PLATS**


Göteborg, Sverige

**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM**


2025-04-01

**YRKESOMRÅDE**


IT



  
Are you passionate about automation, AI, and low-code? Do you want to be part of creating a sustainable future – for real? For us, every employee is an important piece of the puzzle in creating a sustainable tomorrow.



Stena Metall Group IT employ around 180 people and most of us are based at Stena Metall's head office in Majorna, Gothenburg. We offer technical solutions and services tailored to the specific needs of our various companies. We act in a fast paced and intrapreneurial environment and work closely with our customers to design, implement and support solutions that drive value for the Stena Metall Group's various companies.



Your career at Stena Metall Group IT starts here!


**Best things working at Stena Metall Group IT?**


*“The dynamics, we are constantly renewing ourselves and thus learning new things.”*


*“The colleagues are absolutely wonderful.”*


*“Great opportunities to develop and contribute with your own ideas.”*



You will be part of the Software and Integration group. We are more than 25 software engineers working with different digital products, and are responsible for all integrations within Stena Metall.



Besides Integrations and Software development the group hold the responsibility for the Power Platform. As a Power Platform Specialist, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and deploying solutions in Microsoft Power Platform to meet business needs. Responsibility for supporting/training citizen developers, governance, maintenance and driving the platform forward will also be part of your responsibility.


**Are you the Power Platform Specialist we are looking for?**



We have a friendly and helpful culture with close relationships to our stakeholders. To be at the forefront of the rapidly evolving low-code & AI technology is one of the many exciting aspects of working here.


**Key responsibilities – include, but are not limited to:**


* Designing, developing, and providing solutions in Microsoft Power Platform & Copilot Studio
* Collaborating with the business and other stakeholders to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for AI solutions
* Developing and maintaining Power Platform infrastructure and tools
* Keeping up to date with the latest developments in Microsoft Power Platform
* Communicating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Educating and supporting Citizen Developers in the organization


**We wish that you meet the following points:**


* Higher education in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or equivalent knowledge through work experience
* Solid experience with Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI & Copilot Studio
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Knowledge about creating AI Assistants
* Knowledge about Generative AI
* Knowledge of relational database technologies.


**It is advantageous if you also:**


* Are certified in AI & Microsoft Power Platform. Examples of relevant certifications:
* Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
* Power Platform Developer Associate
* Have experience working in a DevOps culture and with tools like AzureDevOps or similar
* Have experience working agile


**Our offer**



Working for Stena Metall, you will join us in creating a better future. There are plenty of possibilities to develop your expertise and competence depending on your professional goals. We offer a range of benefits that you can expect from a company of our size. To mention some nice ones, we have 7 hours workday during summer months and 1.5 hours free training during working hours per week. And if you like travelling, you probably appreciate our discount on the Stena boats.



We have flexible working hours, but we like you to be at our office 3 days a week. If you’re passionate about software development, and delivering high-quality solutions, we’d love to hear from you!
  
**ANSÖKAN**
-----------


Hope we have caught your attention. Join our ride today and help us, by using your potential, to make a difference and form a sustainable tomorrow! We look forward to your application as soon as possible, selection will be running continuously. We do background check in the recrutmentprocess  

  

**Sista ansökningsdatum:**  

2025-04-01
**DATASKYDDSDEKLARATION**
-------------------------


Stena Metall AB har åtagit sig att skydda och respektera din integritet. Vi vill att du ska känna dig trygg när vi behandlar dina personuppgifter. För att säkerställa en hög skyddsnivå för de personuppgifter du delar med oss kommer vi inte att behandla de ansökningar som skickas till oss via e-post. Skicka in din ansökan enligt instruktionerna.

title: Senior Cassandra SRE
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.


Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analyzed. Tink handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what Tink engineers are doing.


What we are looking for:


We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Stateful team. Working from our office in Stockholm and help us maintain, expand and evolve our Cassandra database offering.


The Stateful team is the backbone of our data infrastructure and tooling. Playing a vital role in delivering essential database services and developing tools to meet the evolving needs of the Tink organization. We are actively expanding our team, seeking talented Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) and DevOps engineers who can bring their expertise to drive our database services to new heights.


What we offer you:


A position in the Stateful team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:

* Ensuring scalability and reliability of our most critical operational data store. Primarily Cassandra.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the database services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

 **Qualifications**  

Basic Qualification  

* 5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years


of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0  

years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.  

* Proven experience in managing Cassandra databases at scale.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog


  

Preferred Qualification  

* 6 or more years of work experience with a Bachelors Degree or 4 or more years


of relevant experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or  

up to 3 years of relevant experience with a PhD  

* Familiarity with AWS, RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, Zookeeper, and Kafka
* Extensive industry experience, including mentoring of junior engineers.
 **Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Are you a talented DevOps engineer with expertise in cloud platforms like Azure and AWS? We're on the lookout for someone just like you to join our CloudOps & Platform Engineering team within Fortum, specifically within the Cyber Security Platforms technical squad!  

The location for this role can be in one of our offices in Espoo, Solna, or Wroclaw.  

  

**About the role**  

In this role as Senior Platform Engineer, you'll be at the forefront of developing our SOC platform and working closely with our SOC team to craft innovative threat detection solutions. You'll also have the opportunity to work with OT environments, making this role even more exciting for those with a blend of IT and OT experience. Your work will be supported by the Tech Lead and other engineers in the squad, ensuring you have the resources and collaboration needed to succeed.  


**In the role as Senior Platform Engineer, the following will be part of your responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain our SOC platform, ensuring it remains robust and high-performing.
* Partner with the SOC team and the Cyber Security team to develop and implement cutting-edge threat detection mechanisms.
* Streamline deployment, monitoring, and management processes through automation.
* Diagnose and resolve issues related to the SOC platform and cloud infrastructure.
* Uphold security best practices and ensure compliance with industry standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver top-notch solutions.
* Continuously assess and enhance the platform to meet evolving business needs.
* Explore opportunities to work with OT environments, integrating and securing operational technology systems.
* Be on-call for technical support to ensure the platform's reliability and availability.

  


**About you**
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* At least 5 years of proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar software engineering role.
* In-depth knowledge of cloud platforms, particularly Azure and/or AWS.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation with tools like PowerShell, Python, or Bash.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub or Azure DevOps.
* Familiarity with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Terraform or Ansible.
* Experience with Microsoft Sentinel for threat detection and response.
* A solid understanding of security best practices and experience in SOC environments.
* Experience with OT environments and the integration of IT and OT systems is a plus.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and a collaborative team spirit.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

  


**We offer you**  

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.  

  

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.  


**Interested?**  

Submit your application latest on 24th of March. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Petri Miettinen at petri.miettinen@fortum.com or Recruitment Partner Lisa Kylberg at lisa.kylberg@partners.fortum.com.  

Contact details to union representatives in Sweden can be found on the bottom of **this page****.**
To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.  

  

**We are Fortum**  

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
company_description: Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe.

title: Salesforce Tech Lead till Hemfrid!
description:
**Vi söker dig som vill jobba som Salesforce Tech Lead!**
Hemfrid är den ledande aktören för tjänster i hemmet. Vi vill inte bara leverera tjänster av högsta kvalitet - vi vill öka människors livskvalitet. Vår avancerade techplattform säkerställer sömlös tillgång till våra toppklassiga tjänster och våra medarbetare delar samma mål: att ge våra kunder en enklare vardag.
Hemfrid är en del av KEYTO Group koncernen och strävar efter att skapa den ledande, teknikdrivna fullserviceplattformen för hushållstjänster. Vi är dedikerade till att ‘unlock quality of life. Vi tror på styrkan i teknologi och integrerade tjänster för att driva branschen framåt samt skapa enkel tillgång till enastående tjänster och en smidig kundupplevelse. **Om rollen**
Som Salesforce Tech Lead har du det primära ansvaret för den tekniska plattformen och fungerar som en nyckelperson mellan verksamheten och utvecklingsteamet. Du spelar en avgörande roll i att forma och utveckla plattformens tekniska riktning genom att driva tekniska beslut, strategiska riktningar och säkerställa att DevOps-principer tillämpas genom hela utvecklingscykeln. Genom att arbeta nära både affärssidan och utvecklarna säkerställer du att strategiska val stödjer verksamhetens mål och skapar långsiktigt hållbara och effektiva lösningar. Rollen innebär också att coacha och leda teamet mot gemensamma mål, samt säkerställa att lösningarna är hållbara, skalbara och anpassade till verksamhetens behov. Du kommer arbeta med att:
Leda och/eller bidra till alla tekniska aspekter av projekt. Ta helhetsansvar för att designa och implementera nya funktioner.
Hantera utveckling och driftsättning såsom att samordna med projektledare, planera releaser och övervaka driftsättningar.
Analysera behov, definiera lösningsdesign och etablera mätpunkter.
Se till att alla leveranser uppfyller affärsmålen och snabbt hantera eventuella systemproblem.
Dokumentera dataflöden, integrationer och anpassad utveckling.
Designa avancerade integrationer och arkitekturlösningar för att stödja verksamheten.
Ansvara för att säkerhetsstandarder och dataskyddskrav följs i CRM-system.
  

**Din profil**
Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Salesforce-utvecklare.
Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I och/eller II.
Erfarenhet av CI/CD, versionshantering och automatiserade tester.
Tidigare erfarenhet av att leda andra utvecklare.
Flytande i engelska i tal och skrift.
Meriterande med en akademisk examen inom ett tekniskt område.
**Som person**
Kommunikativ, analytisk och strukturerad.
Har drivkraft att utforska och förstå både äldre och nyare delar av tekniken.
Tar initiativ och föreslår proaktivt förbättringar.
Söker ständigt efter sätt att förbättra till fördel för verksamheten.
 **Ansökan**
Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst med start enligt överenskommelse. Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande och likaså intervjuer. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!  

  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Har du några frågor angående tjänsten eller vår rekryteringsprocess är du varmt välkommen att kontakta oss på **hr@hemfrid.se**.

title: Sogeti Upskill: Testautomation – Stockholm 2025
description:
**Ansök nu**

**Har du arbetslivserfarenhet av test, testautomation eller teknisk testning och vill ta nästa steg inom testautomation? Vi erbjuder en unik möjlighet att få växa i sin roll inom Quality Engineering and Testing (QET).**


**Vad du får som deltagare i Sogeti Upskill-programmet:**


* Earn while you learn: Lön från första dagen.
* Intensivutbildning och praktiska uppdrag: Kombinera konsultuppdrag med utbildningar för att snabbt komma in i rollen som en fullfjädrad konsult.
* Certifieringar inom testområdet: Vi säkerställer att du får de nödvändiga certifieringarna som stärker din kompetens och anställningsbarhet.
* Utveckling inom testautomation och funktionell testning: Arbeta med de senaste verktygen och metoderna inom testautomation och funktionell testning i webbmiljöer.

Vår ambition på Sogeti är att hitta dig som har potential att bli bäst inom test och hjälpa dig att bli just det.


Genom att delta i Sogeti Upskill för "Testautomation" får du, förutom anställning och lön från dag ett, under fem intensiva månader vidareutveckla den grund du fått i din utbildning och praktiska erfarenhet.


Detta genom att i kombination med utbildningen även ha skarpa konsultuppdrag där du får möjlighet att applicera dina kunskaper på riktigt. Målet är att du snabbare kommer in och blir en fullfjädrad konsult. Fokuset kommer ligga på din personliga och professionella utveckling, därför ser vi det som en självklarhet att samtliga deltagare får möjlighet att certifiera sig inom testområdet.


**Kursstart: 1 September**

Utbildningen sker på plats på vårt fina kontor i Solna Business Park  

Efter avslutad och godkänd utbildning erbjuds en provanställning om 6 månader.


**Programöversikt**
  

**Du lär dig massor på kort tid. Det här ingår i QET-upskill:**


* 5 månaders projektanställning under utbildning
* 6 månaders provanställning vid avklarad utbildning
* Introduktion till Sogeti och konsultrollen
* Uppdrag med fokus på att arbeta med testautomation och funktionell test
* TMap® Quality for cross functional teams-utbildning och certifiering
* Sogetis egna arbetssätt inom Testautomation med senaste trenderna inom Testautomation
* Övningar och inlärning sker i projektform
* Generativ AI fokuserad på Test, Sogeti Gen Ai Amplifier
* Agile-utbildning
* DevOps-utbildning
* Testautomation med open source och licensverktyg (såsom PlayWright, Selenium, Robot Framework, Tricentis Tosca etc)
* Cloud Foundation utbildning & certifieringen
De allra bästa Sogeti-coacherna  
* 

**Vem är du?**



Du har avslutat dina studier inom test och kvalité och har arbetat något år inom IT industrin. Du har en universitets-, högskole- eller yrkeshögskoleutbildning och har drivet och viljan att lära nytt. Vi ser att du pratar och skriver på svenska då utbildningen hålls på svenska. Eftersom vi arbetar för en jämn könsfördelning ser vi gärna kvinnliga sökande till detta program.


Sogeti letar ständigt efter drivna kollegor och de mest lovande rekryterar vi in i vårt Upskill-program. Du ska ha en passion för test och den tekniska nyfikenheten att vilja jobba inom området.


**Vilka är vi:**



Sogeti är världsledande inom **Quality Engineering and Testing**. Med över 5700 professionella testingenjörer inom Sogeti, och 29 000 inom Capgemini-gruppen, tillhandahåller vi ett oöverträffat spektrum av tjänster för effektiv hantering av kvalitet. Vi hjälper våra kunder i deras digitala transformation genom att höja deras kvalitet och effektivitet med hjälp av bland annat intelligent testautomation.


Nu har vi berättat lite om oss och vad vi söker, nu är det din tur att berätta lite mer om dig i din ansökan. Vi hoppas få läsa den redan idag!


**Välkommen in med din ansökan idag, vi behandlar alla ansökningar löpande! Sista ansökningsdagen: 12 maj**


  
**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**


* Ditt Sogeti - *Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!*
* Dina förmåner - *Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!*
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - *Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?*

title: Solution Engineer – Detect & Respond Platforms
description:
At Sandvik Group IT, we’re on a journey towards a more secure and innovative future – enhancing our detect and respond capabilities to support our company's cybersecurity and digital transformation goals. We foster a collaborative environment where every team member’s input is valued, ensuring that all voices are heard.
We’re now looking for a Solution Engineer to join our inclusive, continuously improving and supportive Detect & Respond Platforms team. We look forward to achieving great success in this exciting new chapter – and we want you to join us!
Your new team
The product area Detect & Respond Platforms (DRP) is an internal capability enabler for Sandvik’s Global Security Operations. Our focus is on Microsoft Defender technologies and we’re a trusted internal party enabling, maintaining, supporting and providing expertise for owned tools. We’re a team where transparency and sharing best practices pervades our culture. Our mission is to be proactive in identifying and addressing needs and gaps.
About your job
In this position, your main task is to maintain and enhance our MS Sentinel in all aspects of technology, people and processes. Though your focus is on Sentinel, you also contribute to other areas of DRP’s delivery. As a member of DRP, you’re part of a team with openness and collaboration as core, where internal knowledge transfer and growth are key factors to maintain a high-quality delivery.
You understand stakeholder needs and requirements and translate them into specifications and functionality – developing, testing and implementing solutions, while maintaining technical documentation. You proactively suggest new functionality and efficiency improvements and provide support for operation and delivery as needed.  

The location for this position is flexible within Sweden and we offer a hybrid work solution. Your team is primarily located in Stockholm while stakeholders and other teams are in Sandviken and regular presence in these sites is necessary.
About you
We’re looking for an experienced engineer, preferably with a background from a larger global organization. You have proficiency in Microsoft Sentinel, including a strong understanding of its features, capabilities and configuration. Familiarity with Azure security certifications and related Microsoft security solutions is considered a plus, as is experience with Linux and DevOps, including deployment pipelines and GitHub.
To be successful in this role, you also need:* Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices, including threat detection, incident response and vulnerability assessment.
* Scripting languages skills, particularly in PowerShell, Python or similar.
* Relevant education or equivalent knowledge gained from a working career.
* Profound communication skills in English, while knowledge in Swedish is a plus.


You have an analytical and problem-solving mindset, enabling you to make data-driven decisions and find effective solutions. You thrive in an ever-changing environment, can work independently with limited supervision and quickly switch tasks. Being a true team player, you share knowledge, support and coach colleagues. Your excellent communication skills enable you to collaborate effectively and build strong relationships based on honesty and trust.
Our culture
At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Petra Englund, recruiting manager, petra.englund@sandvik.com.
We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist
How to apply
This recruitment has an ongoing selection process, please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than March 23, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0067487.
As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group* *providing solutions* *that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41**,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.*
