title: Poker QA Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about ensuring high-quality software products? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and have an eye for detail? Do you have a genuine interest in Poker?
  
At Relax Gaming, we are looking for a dedicated and meticulous Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Poker team. As a QA Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining the high standards of our Poker product and services closely with a team of talent.
  
With constant improvements, new features, game formats and promotions we have a packed roadmap and a backlog full of ideas that will require your detailed eye to ensure smooth delivery. Are you ready to help us bring those ideas to life?
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Collaborate with business and delivery teams to understand project requirements and deliverables
  
Be responsive to deadlines and work well under pressure
  
Find and/or reproduce bugs and defects in our product, investigating and reporting on these and verifying fixes before games going live
  
Documenting test results accurately
  
Utilize testing tools to enhance testing processes
  
Ensure compliance with quality standards and procedures
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Relevant working experience as software quality assurance
  
Good understanding of game development and software testing methods
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  
Methodical with consistent excellent attention to detail, ability to remain focused when approaching repetitive tasks
  
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal
  
  

**Bonus Points:**  

Passion for Poker
  
Experience in iGaming
  
Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies
  
Proficiency in using testing tools such as Selenium, JIRA, and TestRail
  
  

**Why Join Relax Gaming:**  

Be part of an innovative company that values creativity and collaboration
  
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
  
Work with a supportive team that is passionate about delivering high-quality products
  
Engage in challenging projects that allow you to grow your skills and expertise
  
Enjoy a flexible and inclusive work environment that promotes work-life balance
  
  

If you are meticulous, team-oriented, and eager to grow your career, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join Relax Gaming and contribute to our commitment to quality excellence.
  
About Relax Gaming
  
Back in 2010, we kicked off our journey with a simple mission - to create outstanding games for the modern iGaming world. Fast forward to today, and we've grown to be one of the leading suppliers in the game, boasting an aggregation arm like no other. Despite our exponential growth, we've succeeded in staying true to our core values throughout the years, these are to be: Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful. We live and breathe this ethos across our offices across the globe, namely in Malta, Estonia, Serbia, Finland, Sweden, Gibraltar, and the Isle of Man. Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.
  
Life at Relax
  
This role is placed in Malmö or Tallinn.
  
Relax is at a very exciting growth stage as a company; however, we cherish our informal and flexible core atmosphere where self-initiative, taking pride in what you do and ambition to deliver the best results are key components. For the right person, there are endless opportunities for personal and professional development.
  
All applications are handled in full confidentiality.

title: Customer Supportmedarbetare
description:
**Är du en erfaren problemlösare? Vill du bidra till att ge våra kunder den bästa upplevelsen samtidigt som du arbetar i ett innovativt företag med ambitiösa mål? Då vill vi gärna höra från dig!**

### **Arbetsplats:** **Linköping**


Milient är ett innovativt SaaS-företag som utvecklar omfattande projektledningsprogramvara. Våra produkter används dagligen av projektorienterade verksamheter som arkitekter, konsulter och ingenjörer. Vi på Milient värdesätter innovation, samarbete och kontinuerligt lärande. Som en del av vårt dynamiska team i Linköping får du möjlighet att arbeta i en inkluderande miljö som uppmuntrar till personlig och professionell utveckling.

### **Jobbeskrivning**


Vi söker nu en engagerad och driven person till vårt supportteam i Linköping. Som supportmedarbetare kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att representera Milient och hjälpa våra kunder med deras utmaningar och säkerställa en fantastisk kundupplevelse.

### **Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**

* Hantera och lösa förfrågningar från kunder via telefon, e-post och chat.
* Felsöka problem relaterade till våra lösningar.
* Ge utbildning och vägledning till kunder i användningen av våra produkter och tjänster.
* Registrera, följa upp och avsluta ärenden i vårt ticketing-system.
* Bidra till förbättring av interna processer och kundlösningar.

### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har minst 1-2 års erfarenhet av kundsupport, har du även teknisk kunskap är detta ett plus.
* Kommunicerar klart och professionellt på både svenska och engelska, skriftligt och muntligt.
* Är lösningsorienterad, analytisk och kan hantera komplexa utmaningar.
* Trivs i en hektisk miljö och har förmågan att prioritera effektivt.
* Har en kundorienterad inställning och motiveras av att leverera förstklassig service.

### **Vi erbjuder:**

* En nyckelroll i ett ambitiöst och framåtblickande företag med höga tillväxtmål.
* En dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din erfarenhet och kompetens värderas.
* Möjligheter att utvecklas tillsammans med vårt växande företag.

### **Skicka oss ditt CV och en kort ansökan där du berättar varför du vill bli en del av Milient Software.**

### **Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta peter.goransson@milientsoftware.com**

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Frontend Engineer - React & React Native
description:
Since our inception in 2017, Anyfin has empowered thousands across Sweden, Finland, Germany, and Norway to manage their finances better, saving millions through smart refinancing options. We’re growing rapidly and have big ambitions on the horizon, with new markets to explore and impactful products to launch. To fuel our mission, we’re seeking a dedicated and talented Frontend Engineer who’s ready to create seamless and innovative digital experiences for our users across web and mobile platforms.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Frontend Engineer at Anyfin, you’ll play an essential role in building and enhancing our user-facing applications, ensuring they are intuitive, performant, and visually stunning. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver world-class solutions across web and mobile platforms. Here’s how you’ll contribute:
   

  

* Feature Development: Design, develop, and maintain features across our web and mobile platforms using React and React Native. Build reusable components and front-end libraries that promote scalability and efficiency. Contribute to our mobile app’s development using React Native, ensuring smooth functionality and aesthetic appeal on both iOS and Android.
* UI Implementation: Collaborate closely with our design team to bring pixel-perfect UIs to life, utilizing styled-components for visual consistency and Storybook for efficient component management.
* API Integration: Integrate with our GraphQL API, ensuring that data is managed seamlessly within the app, fostering efficient client-server interactions that keep our app performing at its best.
* Code Quality & Type Safety: Write well-structured, maintainable code with a strong focus on TypeScript for clarity and type safety, promoting a clean codebase and scalable solutions across the development lifecycle.
* Experimentation & Growth: Partner with our product team to implement and track features through Growth Book experiments, helping optimize user engagement and continuously improving our mobile experience.
* Testing & QA: Develop and maintain automated end-to-end tests to ensure stability and high-quality code delivery, allowing us to release with confidence and reliability.


**Who You Are**
 You have a passion for frontend development and have worked with React and TypeScript, either professionally or through personal projects. You’re eager to learn and contribute to building highly interactive web applications. While experience with React Native is a bonus, your willingness to grow into this area is what counts most. You value writing clean and maintainable code and enjoy collaborating with designers and other engineers to bring ideas to life. You’re curious about working with APIs, experimenting with new ideas, and ensuring a great user experience through testing and iteration. Most importantly, you thrive in a supportive team environment where learning and growth are celebrated.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

***Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.***
 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to reduce the costs of high-interest loans, get a detailed overview of their fixed costs, and see their credit score.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Job Description:
 



 We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer with 6-8 years of experience to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in designing and implementing microservice architectures, with a focus on creating testable, logical domains and planning for gradual deployments and technical improvements.
 



 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Microservice Architecture Design: Design and implement microservice architectures that are scalable, maintainable, and aligned with business objectives.
* Domain Decomposition: Break down complex functionalities into testable, logical domains to enhance modularity and ease of maintenance.
* Integration Management: Oversee integrations between various services, ensuring seamless communication and data flow.
* Deployment Planning: Develop and execute plans for gradual deployments, minimizing risks and ensuring system stability.
* Refactoring and Technical Improvements: Identify areas for refactoring and implement technical improvements to enhance system performance and maintainability.
* Requirement Analysis: Actively participate in defining requirements, clarifying ambiguities, and addressing design issues.
* Business Alignment: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and deliver value-driven solutions.
* Agile Collaboration: Work effectively as part of an agile team, contributing to sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.



 Essential Skills:
 


* Proven experience with microservice architecture design and implementation.
* Strong ability to decompose functionalities into logical domains.
* Experience with service integrations and deployment strategies.
* Solid understanding of planning and executing system refactoring and technical enhancements.
* Familiarity with TypeScript, React/React Native, Node.js, Next.js, PostgreSQL, Terraform (AWS/Azure), GitHub Actions, Cypress/Playwright, and Docker.



 Desirable Skills:
 


* Active participation in requirement definition and design processes.
* Proven ability to identify and address design issues proactively.
* Strong drive to understand and deliver business value.
* Experience working within agile development teams.

title: Java System Developer
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Java System Developer 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Public Health Agency is looking for an experienced system developer (level 4) with well-developed Java skills (full stack). The consultant will be part of one of our agile development and management teams as a developer. You need to be confident in your knowledge and experience and have a well-developed ability to collaborate and advise between operations and internal stakeholders, as well as have a deep understanding of regulatory compliance. The Public Health Agency has a national responsibility for public health issues. Our task is to promote good and equal health, prevent diseases and injuries, and work for effective infection control and protect the population from various forms of health threats. Our ongoing projects and administrations deliver system support for, among other things, infection tracking, digital sharing of genetic sequencing data, grant management, vaccinations, antibiotic resistance, fee management, supervision, permits and follow-ups, and monitoring. The consultant may, if deemed necessary, also be part of other assignments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain applications using Java 21 or later.
* Utilize strong knowledge of MariaDB and SQL for database systems.
* Create user interfaces with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript.
* Collaborate using GitLab, Docker Swarm or similar, and Kafka.
* Develop web applications with Angular (17+ or later).
* Design and implement microservices with Quarkus, Microprofile, and Jakarta EE.
* Manage data storage with minIO and StorageGrid S3.
* Improve performance across frontend, backend, database, performance testing, and load testing
* Implement CI/CD pipelines and automate deployments.
* Build and maintain system integrations with REST Open-API.
* Ensure IT and information security compliance in applications.


**Requirements**
* At least 10 years of programming experience, with a focus on Java development.
* Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
* Familiarity with regulatory-controlled operations.
* Very good experience in IT and information security and developing secure applications, securing communication between different microservices
* Good knowledge and experience of Hibernate JPA or similar technologies
* Proficiency with Grafana, Portainer, and Atlassian products
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish, both spoken and written.


**Merit Requirements**
* Very good experience with Kubernetes.
* Good experience integrating with Nextflow or similar microbiological analysis platforms.
* Experience working with IT systems for integration with microbiological analyses.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathi.hr@vipas.se &contact me at +46764341371/+46 739803973
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: AI Developer – Machine Learning & Image Analysis
description:
\*\*\* Please read the entire role description before applying \*\*\*
 



 \*\*\* You must be based in Stockholm \*\*\*
 



 \*\*\* We do not hire students. You must have at least 3 years of experience in AI and software development as well as image analysis \*\*\*
 



  





  





**Company Description** 




 Ecobloom is at the forefront of AI-driven agricultural innovation. We develop intelligent monitoring solutions for controlled-environment agriculture, empowering growers with real-time insights into crop health, climate conditions, and predictive analytics. Our flagship product, EcoSense, leverages AI, machine learning, and advanced data processing to optimize yields and resource efficiency.
 



  





 As we scale our technology, we are looking for an AI Developer to join our team and help drive innovation in predictive modeling, data analysis, and image-based crop monitoring. If you have a passion for AI and sustainable agriculture, this role is for you!
 



  





**Role & Responsibilities** 




 As an AI Developer at Ecobloom, you will:
 



  





 ✅ Develop and optimize machine learning models for predictive analytics in controlled-environment agriculture.
 



 ✅ Work on image processing and computer vision models to analyze plant health, growth patterns, and environmental conditions.
 



 ✅ Design and implement scalable data pipelines for collecting and processing sensor data from greenhouses.
 



 ✅ Deploy and maintain AI models using cloud platforms and cloud-based infrastructure.
 



 ✅ Collaborate with our software and hardware teams to integrate AI solutions into our core platform.
 



 ✅ Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and agritech, ensuring we leverage state-of-the-art techniques.
 



  





**Qualifications & Skills** 




 We are looking for someone with:
 



  





 🔹 Strong proficiency in Python and experience with Django for backend development.
 



 🔹 Extensive experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
 



 🔹 Hands-on experience with image analysis and computer vision (e.g., OpenCV, CNNs, segmentation models).
 



 🔹 Solid knowledge of data science principles, predictive modeling, and time-series forecasting.
 



 🔹 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and cloud-based AI deployments.
 



 🔹 Experience with database management (PostgreSQL, Firebase, or similar).
 


* 🔹 Bonus: Knowledge of IoT, sensor data processing, or reinforcement learning is a plus.



  





**Why Join Ecobloom?** 




  





 🌍
 **Impact:** 
 Work on cutting-edge AI solutions that improve sustainability in food production.
 



 🚀
 **Innovation:** 
 Be part of a fast-growing company shaping the future of AI in agriculture.
 



 🤝
 **Collaboration:** 
 Join a passionate and driven team working at the intersection of AI and agritech.
 



 🏡
 **Flexibility:** 
 Hybrid/remote-friendly work culture.

title: LabVIEW Developer (Stockholm)
description:
🌟 Do you want to build systems that enable research and innovation? Do you enjoy diverse assignments in different technological fields? Are you interested in working at a smaller, specialized consulting company where your ideas are valued? If so, you would be a great fit for Prevas Test & Measurement! We want to offer you an inclusive and supportive work environment where your technical skills and knowledge will be used well.
   

  

*We have been part of Prevas since October 2023, constituting our unit specialized in test and measurement technology.*
**🔎 About The Role**
 As a consultant, you can work onsite with our customers or on projects at our office. We create solutions that help our customers get valuable insights from physical measurements.
   

  

 As a LabVIEW developer, you will be responsible for developing hardware test systems, from concept design to final delivery. The work includes designing and implementing both software and hardware solutions. In our projects, hardware can include electronics, sensors, measurement instruments, control units, mechanics, and more. You will design and develop various systems for hardware testing, such as automated test systems for electronics, mechanical test rigs for the automotive industry, test chambers for functional testing of heat pumps, or inspection systems for MedTech devices.
   

  

**🫵 About You**
 You have a good understanding of physics, possibly through a research background, while being experienced in writing code for hardware control and instrumentation.
   

  

 You enjoy taking initiative when needed and work well both independently and in a team. This means you are driven and able to take responsibility for your contributions. Additionally, you value the balance between listening to others and contributing your ideas, making you a highly appreciated coworker. You are driven by curiosity and motivated to find technical solutions to humankind’s big challenges.
   

  

* You have an MSc in electrical engineering, engineering physics, or equivalent.
* You have at least two years of work experience or a PhD in a relevant field.
* You have experience in interfacing hardware with code that you have written.
* You have experience in LabVIEW at a software developer or software architect level.
* You are proficient at speaking/reading/writing in English (Swedish is a plus).


 ✅
 **To succeed in this role you have experience with one or more of the following...**
* Test system design
* Interfacing hardware
* Control systems
* Protocols such as CAN and Modbus
* Signal processing
* NI hardware
* Mechatronics
* Electrical motors
* Automation
* Sensors
* Python


**🎉 Our Offer**
 At Prevas Test & Measurement you will have the opportunity to engage in both professional and personal growth. We offer flexible work hours, supportive leadership, and regular social activities that strengthen our company community. Our projects are challenging and diverse, we take on anything that can be physically measured, and engage with all industries that handle hardware.
   

  

**🌱 Our Commitment to Sustainability**
 Sustainability is at the core of our mission. We prioritize working with and supporting businesses that develop green technology to tackle environmental challenges. As a part of our team, you will contribute to creating sustainable solutions that exceed our customers’ expectations.
   

  

 We place a lot of focus on creating a fun and sustainable working environment for all our coworkers. On our mission for an equal and inclusive environment, we aim to reach at least a 40% female workforce.
   

  

**📩 Apply Now!**
 Have we caught your interest? We look forward to your application—apply today!
   

  

 Applications close: 2025-03-31.
   

  

****More About Prevas Test & Measurement**
 Prevas Test & Measurement (formerly DVel) specializes in hardware test automation at our office in central Lund. We offer consulting services and/or deliver complete measurement systems and test rigs. Our projects are highly diverse, and our customers exist within several different industries. At present, we have 30 employees and look forward to growing with your addition.**
**As of October 2023, we became a part of Prevas. We are a business unit within Prevas South and will continue to provide expertise in test and measurement.**

title: Integrations Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are seeking a talented and experienced Integrations Specialist to join our small and highly skilled team. Being a part of our team offers you the freedom and trust to take your own initiatives and plan your work accordingly. We believe in empowering our team members to make decisions and take ownership of their projects. This autonomy allows you to explore innovative solutions and contribute to the success of our organization in a meaningful way. You will have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment where your ideas are valued, and you can grow both personally and professionally. You will have the opportunity to work in a company and with a high volume integration platform handling millions of Ecom transactions on a yearly basis, in several countries and across 2 continents.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement complex integration solutions using a Cloud Based Integration Platform (C# based framework)
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze integration requirements.
* Plan, develop, implement and maintain system integrations (For example Ecom/WMS/ERP).
* Document integration processes and provide technical guidance to internal stakeholders.
* As a part of a highly skilled and dedicated team, be involved in improving processes and way of working.
* Be part of ensuring the scalability, stability, long-term development and planning of a modern integration platform.


**What We Want From You**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, people-first environment and is excited to build great stuff. Here’s what will help you succeed:
   

  

* Solid experience in developing and implementing complex integration solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Solid programming skills.


**Nice to have**
* Proficiency in C#.
* Experience working with the cloud-based integrations systems.
* Experience with integrations towards ERP, WMS, and Ecom systems.
* Proficiency with SQL databases.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *Inclusion & Non-Hierarchy* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Mechanical Engineer - OHB Sweden
description:
**OHB Sweden is a leading Swedish supplier of space systems. We develop, build, test and commission satellites and subsystems for space missions in, for example, communication, earth observation and space research for institutional and commercial customers within and outside Europe.**
 Building a satellite requires a broad range of expertise, involving the analysis, design, manufacturing, and testing of both hardware and software. At OHB Sweden, we offer engineers an exceptional opportunity to expand their technical skills across all domains.
   

  

 We are seeking a skilled Mechanical Engineer with experience in the complete chain from CAD mechanical design, FEM analysis, and generation of production drawings to follow-on testing of the manufactured product.
   

  

 Collaborating with external partners (customers, payload suppliers, etc.) to define and implement mechanical interfaces will be an integral part of your daily responsibilities.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Dynamic Work Environment: Engage in a vibrant, international setting with numerous collaboration partners, primarily in Europe.
* Comprehensive Skill Development: Enhance your expertise in various technical domains, from Mechanical design to System engineering.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with system, electrical, thermal, and AIT engineers in the development of cutting-edge satellites.


**What We’re Looking For**
* A structured, motivated, and quick-learning team player.
* Ability to work independently while meeting agreed delivery schedules.
* Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with diverse teams.


 If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of space technology and eager to contribute to innovative satellite projects, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

 If you wish to participate to the development of future space systems, feel confident that your experience and qualifications match the above requirements and want to find yourself in a dynamic and inspiring work environment, then we very much look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Task Description**
* Design mechanical, structural, and dynamic components using CAD and FEM, focusing on stress, shock, and random vibration analyses.
* Generate manufacturing drawings from CAD models.
* Supervise off-site manufacturing of parts and inspect delivered items.
* Support on-site assembly of end products, such as spacecraft structures.
* Define and design test specifications, procedures, and setups for subsystem qualification (structures, mechanisms, units, components, actuators).
* Correlate FE models (e.g., fundamental frequencies, damping coefficients) with actual test results.
* Assist in planning and budgeting for future programs and projects.
* Design, assemble, and test mechanical ground support equipment (MGSE) for integration and test activities.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related disciplines.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in design and testing/production environments
* Relevant experience in design and testing environments related to CAD, mechanical FEM analysis, and construction (experience in aerospace or automotive industries is a plus).
* Proficiency in FEM analysis, particularly in random vibration response, shock, and loads analysis.
* Ability to generate, read, and understand mechanical design/analysis reports and Interface Control Documents (ICDs).
* Clear and coherent reporting and presentation skills in English.
* Experience in design-to-manufacture processes.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* Located in or willing to relocate to Stockholm, Sweden.


**Added Advantageous Qualifications**
* Experience in writing test procedures for vibration and shock.
* Experience in requirements management and verification.
* Proficiency with NASTRAN.
* Experience with CREO and/or NX (CAD) and Windchill PLM.
* Experience working closely with production/MAIT.
* Experience in GPS (Geometric Product Specifications) drawing production.
* Knowledge of the European Cooperation for Space Standardization (ECSS) and experience in the space industry.


 We looking forward to your application!🚀

title: Partner Integration Engineer in Play & Control
description:
**The Team**
 Play & Control handles the music playback on all of our platforms. We have apps for mobile and desktop, our own hardware player and partner integrations through our SDK. We are building an API for custom integrations which we already use ourselves to deliver a custom web radio station where the customer can control the music.
   

  

 We manage the clients playing music and the servers providing them with instructions and remote control functionality.
   

  

**The Role**
**Role**
 We are searching for a skilled Embedded Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in expanding the reach of our music streaming services. You will be working together with the team to facilitate integrations with new partners. This involves:
   

  

* Understanding the partner’s technical requirements and providing guidance on SDK integration best practices.
* Adjusting our offering to improve integration flows and features.
* Developing and maintaining comprehensive technical documentation, including integration guides and sample code.
* Working closely with internal teams to provide feedback and identify areas for improvement in our platforms.
* Staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in the audio technology space.


**About You**
 We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and enjoys working with external partners. You should be a strong communicator, a creative problem-solver, and a team player.
   

  

**Mandatory Requirements**
* Solid understanding of software development principles and experience with C++
* Experience with embedded systems development
* Experience with SDK integrations or API integrations
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills


**Beneficial Skills**
* Experience with audio technologies and streaming protocols such as Dante and AES67
* Familiarity with various operating systems
* Knowledge of networking concepts and protocols
* Experience with programming languages such as C, Rust, Scala, Kotlin, Java, Objective C, Swift, Go, or others.


**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**Employee Benefits**
* You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription.
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by email.

title: Test Leader
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Test Leader 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Test Leader**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for a test leader for the validation of software. The task is to plan the software releases for validation in vehicles, follow up on the status of error codes, and compile this information into a report.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Plan, evaluate tests result in order to provide a recommendation on the approval level of the test object.
* Drive the development and improvement of test processes.
* Act as a sounding board towards function developers and test developers within the system test domain and coordination within the R&D organisation.
* Plan, prioritize and follow up test result.


**Requirements**
* MSc or Bachelor within Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Embedded Systems, Mechatronics or similar.
* Project Management experience is a merit.
* Fluency in English and Swedish.


**The assignment will be performed in Södertälje (Hybrid)**
**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at kumud@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: AI workflow experts
description:
Gullers Grupp Söker Nu Flera Personer i Rollen Som AI Workflow Expert. Uppfyller Du Flera Av Dessa Krav Så Tar Vi Gärna Emot En Ansökan Från Dig

* Du vet hur man använder AI-verktyg för att lösa konkreta problem.

 Tjänsten är visstids-anställning med option på förlängning. Vi välkomnar sökande även från andra orter men rollen utgår primärt från vårt kontor i Stockholm.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Bokadirekt is currently in the middle of an exciting expansion phase. Here, you will be part of an innovative and modern workplace where dedication is strong!
 



  





**About Bokadirekt** 




 Bokadirekt is Sweden's largest app and marketplace for booking mainly beauty and health. With more than 20,000 connected specialists across the country, they make almost all of Sweden's salons and receptions bookable in one place. This includes, for example, hairdressers, masseurs, podiatrists, beauty salons, chiropractors, and much more.
 



  





 At bokadirekt.se, consumers can search, book, and pay for treatments and services with just a few clicks. Every month, 5 million consumers visit bokadirekt.se, and almost 2 million bookings are made via their website and apps.
 



  





 Bokadirekt is growing and employs over 100 people with offices in Stockholm and Luleå.
 



  





**​The Role** 




 Bokadirekt is looking for a passionate iOS Developer to join their team and help shape the future of their mobile applications. In this role, you’ll be part of a talented team, and work together to craft elegant, scalable, and high-performing iOS apps. You’ll work not only with existing features but also play a key role in developing new, innovative solutions that make a real impact. We’re looking for a team player who’s curious about new technologies, enjoys solving complex problems, and thrives in a collaborative environment.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Build iOS applications, and ensure high-quality, scalability, and maintainable solutions
* Collaborate cross-functionally with other product and design teams to ensure the best mobile app for Bokadirekt’s users
* Stay up to date with iOS development trends, ensuring the team follows best practices and leverages the latest technologies



  





**Main Technologies:** 



* Swift
* UIKit
* Swift Concurrency
* SwiftUI



  





**To Succeed In the Role, We Believe You Have Experience In:** 



* 3+ years as a mobile developer, including extensive iOS development experience
* A proven track record of working in high-performing product teams for over 3 years
* Working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver user-centered solutions
* Organizing, growing, maintaining, and modernizing iOS apps effectively
* An interest in app architecture and scalability, ensuring apps are prepared for growth and change



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 This is an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about mobile development and thrives on collaboration. You’ll have the chance to work on meaningful projects at the heart of Bokadirekt while mentoring others and influencing technical strategies. If you’re ready to take your career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





*Bokadirekt is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Javautvecklare till vårt Stockholmskontor
description:
**Är Java din expertis och du vill jobba med ett gäng där du får ett bra kompetensutbyte?** 
**Roliga projekt, duktiga kollegor och utveckling – det får du hos oss!**
 Frontwalker är en växande IT-koncern med bred geografisk spridning i Sverige. Frontwalker Stockholm tillsammans med Frontwalker Group är idag 50+ anställda och vi finns på fyra orter i landet. Hos oss hittar du vassa medarbetare inom systemutveckling, IT Management, kravanalys, test och mycket mer. Du blir en del av ett gäng där vi tillsammans arbetar för att driva och utveckla digitala affärer, mjukvara och människor.
   

  

 Vi arbetar både med inhouse projekt på vårt kontor och i våra kunders projekt som specialister!
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker en skicklig programmerare, med minst 5 års praktiskt erfarenhet som utvecklare, som vill jobba med databehandling i Javabaserade system. Vi ser gärna att du har en akademisk bakgrund eller motsvarande kunskaper.
   

  

 Du kommer få arbeta ganska fritt och utveckla och göra skillnad både på egen hand och i team. Det är viktigt att du gillar att samarbeta, både att bjuda på dina kunskaper och att ta till dig andras.
   

  

 Vi vill att du både kan ta till dig ny teknik när så krävs men också vara beredd att jobba med att underhålla äldre system, kundens behov styr. Du behöver ha kapacitet att förstå stora komplexa system med många beroenden och ha ett säkerhetstänk som en naturlig del av ditt arbete. Förutom programmeringskunskaper behöver du ha goda kunskaper i datamodellering och SQL. Vi ser helst att du har vana att arbeta i Linuxbaserade system. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av molnlösningar, fördelaktigt AWS. Det är meriterande om du har vana att arbeta med Docker, Kubernetes och Frontendramverk, gärna Angular. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av fintech. Utöver det talar och skriver du obehindrat på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En inkluderande arbetsplats
* Work-life balance kultur
* Interna utvecklingsmöjligheter samt kompetensutveckling
* Marknadsmässig lön
* Bra förmåner i form av friskvård, försäkringar osv
* Flexibla arbetstider
* Sist men inte minst – att ha kul på jobbet


 Hos oss ingår du i en grupp med riktigt vassa och duktiga kollegor och du får möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt inom såväl olika myndigheter som inom det privata näringslivet. Vår verksamhet bygger till stor del på kunder som vi har mångåriga relationer med. Därför har de i många fall gett oss förtroendet att bedriva förvaltning och nyutveckling av deras system som inhouse-projekt, samtidigt som vi har rena resursuppdrag. Du kan komma att få det bästa av båda världar!
   

  

 Vi är ett socialt gäng i olika åldrar som gärna umgås och har kul ihop, spelar en pingis på rasten eller ses på aktiviteter efter jobbet - det hoppas vi att du också uppskattar. Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
   

  

**Vill du vara en Frontwalker?**
 Vad väntar du på? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande. Vid frågor om rekryteringen är du välkommen att kontakta Carolina Gustavson på 073 505 42 34 eller mejla till rekrytering@frontwalker.se. Notera att vi inte tar emot några ansökningar via mail samt att CV ska vara på svenska.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen att höra av dig!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
I
 **Stretch Beyond** 
 tror vi att data spelar en central roll i omställningen till hållbara affärsmodeller och självklart ser du också potentialen i datadriven effektivisering.
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som verkligen gillar data och vill använda det intresset till att exempelvis energieffektivisera sjukhus och underbygga jämställdhet. Du kan förvänta dig en arbetsplats i högt tempo där du får ta stort eget ansvar i omväxlande och utmanande åtaganden där vi oftast hjälps åt att hitta lösningar med Microsofts BI-stack.
   

  

 Om du vill vara med från starten av ett nytt team i ett väletablerat konsultbolag finns här möjligheten att bidra med din djupa kompetens. Du får vara med från grunden men har tryggheten och den sociala samvaron som är en självklarhet i Stretchgruppen. Vi erbjuder dig en naturlig plats i vardagen och möjligheten att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss är det okej med flexibilitet, vi sitter gärna tillsammans på Gamla Brogatan 26 eller ute hos kund men samarbetar väl digitalt också.
   

  

**Vi tror att du som person...**
* Är en noggrann problemlösare som inte ger dig
* Gillar tekniska utmaningar
* Intresserar dig för ny teknik
* Vill både dela med dig av din kunskap och lära av andra
* Uppskattar högt tempo


**Erfarenheter som hjälper dig att lyckas i denna roll...**
* Datahantering i Azure SQL, Spark, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric eller motsvarande
* Avancerad SQL
* Lösningar i Python
* Power BI
* Relevant utbildning och/eller längre arbetslivserfarenhet
* Konsulterfarenhet och/eller projekterfarenhet


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälsar teamet på Stretch Beyond

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in 100+ cities with over 275+ MILLION rides to date. It has been an amazing journey and we have no intention of stopping now!**
**As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining machine learning models across key business areas. Your work will involve tackling challenges that draw on your expertise in interconnected fields such as software engineering, data engineering, data science, and machine learning. Ultimately, you will drive and contribute to solutions addressing some of our most important challenges, including maximizing availability, reliability, and safety. You will join a team uniquely positioned to ensure our users always have a scooter nearby when and where they need it. Additionally, you will play a pivotal role in anticipating and addressing vehicle maintenance needs early, which is essential for delivering an exceptional riding experience.**
****YOUR MISSION AT VOI****
* You will be an integral part of a cross-functional product team, contributing to end-to-end machine learning projects. This includes starting with a business problem, developing solution hypotheses, defining data requirements, creating prototypes, implementing solutions in production, and measuring their business impact
* Self-sufficiently drive and develop production-grade models with an emphasis on reliability and scalability. Collaborate with the product manager to prioritize solution paths, ensuring a focus on delivering the greatest business impact
* Enhance and maintain our machine learning platform, ensuring that Voi’s machine learning products adhere to state-of-the-art MLOps standards
* Influence and introduce strategic topics, including decisions on tech stack, enhancements to team workflows, and collaborative prioritization of product directions with the product manager, based on feasibility and anticipated business impact.
* Guide, coach, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance team and functional workflows, fostering a culture of mutual support, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing


**What You Need To Embark**
 We’re looking for a Machine Learning professional with experience from working in a fast-paced environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
   

  

* A higher education degree in a mathematical science such as computer science, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics, or a similar data-focused field
* A strong business sense with laser focus on business value and user impact
* Fluency in Python in particular and software engineering practices in general
* Documented experience of working with MLOps in GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure
* Documented experience in developing production-quality software
* Hands-on contribution to managing projects from start to finish – from tackling business challenges to planning, building, launching, and keeping an eye on the results


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.
